events.originalText: "Il Canto degli Italiani" officially became the national anthem of Italy, 66 years after it was provisionally chosen following the birth of the Italian Republic.
events.subtitle: Il Canto degli Italiani
events.headline: Italy officially adopts 'Il Canto degli Italiani' as national anthem

events.originalText: Six black teenagers assaulted a white student in Jena, Louisiana; the subsequent court cases became a cause célèbre for perceived racial injustice in the United States.
events.subtitle: Jena Six
events.headline: Racially charged assault in Jena, Louisiana sparks national debate

events.originalText: U.S. president George H. W. Bush ordered American troops into Somalia to help provide humanitarian aid and restore order during the ongoing Somali Civil War.
events.subtitle: George H. W. Bush
events.headline: George H. W. Bush sends troops to Somalia for humanitarian aid

events.originalText: The MV Amazon Venture oil tanker starts leaking while at the port of Savannah, resulting in an oil spill of approximately 500,000 US gallons (1,900,000 L).
events.subtitle: Port of Savannah
events.headline: MV Amazon Venture oil tanker leaks in Savannah port, causing massive spill

events.originalText: The English rock group Led Zeppelin officially disbanded.
events.subtitle: Led Zeppelin
events.headline: Led Zeppelin disbands after successful rock career

events.originalText: Indo-Pakistani War: The Indian Navy launched a successful attack against the Pakistan Navy at Karachi, sinking three ships with no Indian casualties.
events.subtitle: Indo-Pakistani war of 1971
events.headline: Indian Navy sinks three Pakistan Navy ships in Karachi attack

events.originalText: Fred Hampton, the leader of the Illinois chapter of the Black Panther Party, and Mark Clark were killed in a raid by Chicago police officers in what many scholars consider an illegal assassination.* *1971 – The Troubles: The Ulster Volunteer Force, an Ulster-loyalist paramilitary group, detonated a bomb at a Catholic-owned pub in Belfast, Northern Ireland, killing 15 people.* 1978 – Following the murder of Mayor George Moscone, Dianne Feinstein became San Francisco's first female mayor.
events.subtitle: Fred Hampton
events.headline: Black Panther Party leader Fred Hampton killed in Chicago raid

events.originalText: Cosmo Gordon Lang was enthroned as the Archbishop of Canterbury, the first bachelor to be appointed in 150 years.
events.subtitle: Cosmo Gordon Lang
events.headline: Ulster Volunteer Force bomb kills 15 in Belfast pub

events.originalText: The first Grey Cup, the championship game of the Canadian Football League, was held in Toronto.
events.subtitle: 1st Grey Cup
events.headline: Dianne Feinstein becomes San Francisco's first female mayor

events.originalText: First Matabele War: A patrol of 34 British South Africa Company soldiers was ambushed and annihilated by more than 3,000 Matabele warriors.
events.subtitle: First Matabele War
events.headline: Cosmo Gordon Lang appointed as Archbishop of Canterbury

events.originalText: The American brigantine Mary Celeste was found apparently abandoned under circumstances that remain unknown.
events.subtitle: Brigantine
events.headline: First Grey Cup championship game held in Toronto

events.originalText: Sati, the Hindu funeral custom of a widow's self-immolation on her husband's pyre, was prohibited by Lord William Bentinck  in parts of British India after years of campaigning by Ram Mohan Roy (pictured).
events.subtitle: Sati (practice)
events.headline: British soldiers ambushed and annihilated by Matabele warriors

events.originalText: Jeremiah Horrocks and William Crabtree made the first successful observation  of a transit of Venus (example pictured) from Earth.
events.subtitle: Jeremiah Horrocks
events.headline: Mystery surrounds abandoned American brigantine Mary Celeste

events.originalText: Hundred Years' War: In two separate engagements in the Battle of Pontvallain, French forces wiped out an English army which had split up because of a dispute between the commanders.
events.subtitle: Hundred Years' War
events.headline: Lord William Bentinck prohibits Sati funeral custom in British India
